title: Lake Kuttara
text:
is a nearly circular <a href="caldera">caldera</a> lake in <a href="Shiraoi%2C%20Hokkaid%C5%8D">Shiraoi</a>, <a href="Hokkaid%C5%8D">Hokkaidō</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. It is part of <a href="Shikotsu-T%C5%8Dya%20National%20Park">Shikotsu-Tōya National Park</a>. The lake is recognized as having the best water quality in all of Japan. With a transparency of , the lake ranks second to <a href="Lake%20Mash%C5%AB">Lake Mashū</a> according to the <a href="Ministry%20of%20the%20Environment%20%28Japan%29">Ministry of the Environment</a>.
Resident species of the lake include a <a href="salamander">salamander</a> species, . Since 1909, <a href="Sockeye%20salmon">Sockeye salmon</a> have been introduced to the lake.
